intro: Planchonella latihila, commonly known as the Hilo hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature and turn yellow or red when ripe. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
